text: hey, can I ask what's the meaning of the 'view' column? (linear regression case study-housing) it doesn't appear in the instructions and goes from 0 to 4...

elements.text: hey, can I ask what's the meaning of the 'view' column? (linear regression case study-housing) it doesn't appear in the instructions and goes from 0 to 4...

text: well spotted, ill take a look now!

elements.text: well spotted, ill take a look now!

text: i see this is missing from the column definitions, ill ask the global team to add it. As i remember this column means ‘does the property have a view’ 0 = no, we can infer therefore that 1-4 is yes, with the number increase indicating the quality of the view gets better or that the view is open all sides. You can assume the 319 properties with a view= 4, means the property has a fantastic view or a view on all sides of the house. a 0 property means the house is facing other houses, or a brick wall.

elements.text: i see this is missing from the column definitions, ill ask the global team to add it. text: I am going to run an OPTIONAL tableau explore and viz workshop tomorrow morning at 11am, working with the data sets on both case studies… this is not to run through the solutions to the questions but to give some suggestions on how to visualise the data, I will also spend some time on bringing separate views together into a simple interactive dashboard - this will be recorded, probably available later that afternoon (depending on zoom)

text:
<!channel>,
:mysql:  when you import the `.csv` for the :house: housing data, pay attention to the encoding. We figured out in one of the groups (with the help of good guy :morning-sunshine: ) that *Latin1 (iso8859-1)* did the trick (no UTF or sth... ) - you should come out at 21596 rows

with the :credit_card: database it could be similar
